intro: Spuriopimpinella brachystyla, commonly known as the short-stemmed whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its small, white flowers appear in umbels, and its leaves are finely divided, giving it a delicate appearance. It is characterized by its short, stout stems and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions.
